intro: Cissampelos mallophylla, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant produces distinctive, fleshy, orange-red berries that are a characteristic feature of its fruiting stage. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
